decks.notes: This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly disrupting and applying pressure to the opponent with efficient creatures and removal spells. The deck aims to control the board early with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, then close out the game with powerful threats like Archfiend of the Dross and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The mix of disruption, aggression, and resilience makes it a formidable deck in Pioneer 1 vs 1 matches, allowing you to push through damage and outvalue your opponent.

This Jund aggro deck focuses on utilizing the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring to ramp up and provide flexibility in mana costs. The deck includes a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and Heartless Act, along with creature cards like Mayhem Devil and Bloodtithe Harvester to apply pressure on the opponent. The combination of Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven provides recurring value, while cards like Ygra, Eater of All and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker offer additional ways to close out games quickly. Overall, the deck aims to be aggressive and efficient in its game plan.

The deck revolves around utilizing Transmogrify to cheat powerful creatures onto the battlefield. The key strategy is to cast Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to create a token copy of a powerful creature like Atraxa, Grand Unifier or Ob Nixilis, the Adversary, then use Transmogrify to turn that token into the real creature. The deck also includes disruption in the form of removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the game until the combo can be assembled. Additionally, support cards like Case of the Stashed Skeleton and Reckoner Bankbuster provide additional value and synergy.

The main focus of this deck is to deploy quick and efficient creatures and burn spells to deal direct damage to the opponent as fast as possible. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Ghitu Lavarunner and Monastery Swiftspear, along with burn spells such as Skewer the Critics and Play with Fire, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently. Den of the Bugbear and Ramunap Ruins provide additional sources of damage, while cards like Light Up the Stage help maintain card advantage. The addition of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion offers additional flexibility and value to the deck.

The focus of this deck is to utilize the cards that interact with artifacts and sacrifice mechanics to create a powerful combo that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. By combining cards like Indomitable Creativity and Case of the Stashed Skeleton with a variety of removal and creature buff spells, the deck aims to control the board and generate a win condition through a series of creative plays. Atraxa, Grand Unifier acts as a key piece in this combo strategy, providing additional utility and support for the deck's overall game plan.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly defeat opponents. The deck includes low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Heartfire Hero, backed up by spells like Infuriate and Fatal Push for removal and additional damage. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds a versatile mana source to the deck. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game to secure a swift victory.

This deck focuses on quickly casting spells to fill up the graveyard and bring back Arclight Phoenix for repeated attacks. It includes cheap spells like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe to trigger the Phoenix's ability, as well as card draw spells like Consider and Treasure Cruise to maintain hand advantage. Picklock Prankster helps with additional damage while Artist's Talent allows for copy spells to be used for extra value. The deck also includes some control elements with Spell Pierce and Into the Flood Maw to disrupt the opponent's game plan.
